Culinary Profile & Uses

1. Flavour and Form ‘Metro-Needle’ offers a delicate, slightly sweet and fruity flavor with a clean, crisp bite. The caps are small, honey-gold to amber-brown, and convex, topping slender, wiry stems that are pale tan and develop a characteristic velvety texture at the base. The mushrooms grow in dense, upright clusters resembling a miniature forest, with stems reaching 8-12 cm in height - long and elegant, yet sturdier than commercially forced varieties.

2. The Delicate Crunch & Soup Specialist This mushroom’s unique texture and mild flavor make it ideal for dishes where subtlety and mouthfeel are paramount.

  • Hot Pot and Soup Essential: The premier use - added to miso soup, ramen, or hot pots during the final moments of cooking, where they wilt slightly but retain a pleasant, al dente crunch.
  • Salads and Crudité: Raw, young clusters can be separated and added to salads for a crisp, mild mushroom flavor and elegant appearance.
  • Quick Sauté or Stir-fry: Cooked very briefly over high heat to preserve their crisp-tender texture, perfect for noodle dishes and vegetable sautés.
  • Garnish with Texture: Used as a delicate, edible garnish for soups and Asian-inspired dishes, providing both visual appeal and a subtle crunch.

3. The Harvest and Yield ‘Metro-Needle’ is a cool-weather fruiter that produces abundant clusters. Harvest entire clusters by twisting at the base when the majority of caps are open but before the stems become tough. Supplied as a pre-colonized MycoBlock™, it provides a prolific yield of numerous dense clusters totaling 300–500g, with fruiting typically occurring in flushes during cooler temperatures, 14-20 days after initiation.
